conclusion: Use properties of light refraction in a prism and apply Snell's law.
Identify given values: refractive index of red light is n = sqrt(3), incident angle alpha = 60 degrees.
Apply Snell's law: n1/n2 = sin(theta1)/sin(theta2) with n1 = sqrt(3), n2 = 1, theta1 = 60 degrees.
Calculate angle theta2: sin(60 degrees) = sqrt(3)/2, theta2 = sin^(-1)(sqrt(3)/2).
Calculate angle between emergent light and incident light: theta = theta2 - alpha = sin^(-1)(sqrt(3)/2) - 60 degrees.
Calculate angle: theta = sin^(-1)(sqrt(3)/2) - 60 degrees approximately 30 degrees.
Determine angle between emergent light and incident light: theta = 180 degrees - 60 degrees - 30 degrees = 90 degrees.
The angle between the emergent light and the incident light is 90 degrees.
